III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) The facility does not serve clients from the plaintiff class that fall under the
Modified Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP).
3.) The facility does not have a contract with the department.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance for this period under review.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has not submitted corrective action plans during this licensing
period.
A tour of the facility was conducted as a part of the inspection. The facility is a
home setting with two floors with the lower level utilized for recreation and
programming. The kitchen had plenty of food and there was a menu posted on
the refrigerator for the residents to review. The medication storage was double
locked in the staff office, and the medical chart was appropriate. The resident’s
rooms were appropriately clean and well furnished. The home was very clean
and well maintained.
During the course of the inspection residents and staff members were interviewed.
The staff reported feeling supported and did not report any concerns. The residents
interviewed reported feeling safe at Footprints. One resident reported liking the
structure and opportunities given to her while placed at Footprints. The second
resident reported she was happy to be focusing on school however was anxious to
finish the program and return home. Overall, there were no concerns noted by the
staff or residents interviewed.
1

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and MISEP requirements. It is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
